abstract.p: Roundup of advertising account changes (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Soft Sheen Products, Chicago, part of the Cosmair unit of L'Oreal, to the Burrell Communications Group, Chicago, to introduce a hair care product line, Breakthru, aimed at black consumers, and to handle advertising for other brands like Alternatives, Care Free Curl, Frizz Free, Mizani and Optimum Care. The account had been at Spike DDB, New York, which is owned by the director Spike Lee and the DDB Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group. Billings were not disclosed. Burrell is 49 percent owned by Publicis S.A. * Kemper Insurance Companies, Long Grove, Ill., to Cramer-Krasselt, Chicago, to handle its account, which had been at Kemper Lesnik Communications, Chicago. Spending was estimated at $10 million to $12 million. * inTravelnet.com, Vancouver, British Columbia, a leisure travel and information services company, to MMG Worldwide, Kansas City, Mo., to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at $11 million. * Surfnotes, Jerusalem and New York, a technology company that sorts information and research on the Web, to the Chicago office of Young & Rubicam Advertising, to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at more than $10 million. * Specialty Brands Inc., Ontario, Calif., to Campbell Mithun Esty, Minneapolis, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle the introduction of its first national consumer brand, Jose Ole, a line of Mexican frozen foods. Billings were estimated at $10 million. Specialty is part of the Foodbrands America subsidiary of IBP.
